author: Cain A. Knight
title: Tony Khan uses WWE numbers to explain why AEW deserves ‚Äòa big pay raise‚Äô on next TV deal - Cageside Seats
text: AEW is negotiating terms for a new TV deal right now with its broadcast partner Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), at the same time that WWE is rumored to be seeking $400 million per year on its next TV deal for Raw. There‚Äôs actually a scenario where WWE Raw ends up on WBD, which [could spell disaster](https://www.cagesideseats.com/wwe/2023/12/14/24001238/report-wwe-raw-tv-deal-negotiations-wbd-warner-bros-cm-punk-return-zaslav-aew-forced-out-tony-khan) for All Elite Wrestling. On a call with the media today ahead of the Worlds End pay-per-view on Saturday night, AEW President Tony Khan was confident about continuing his current business relationship with WBD in 2024 and beyond, but also asserted there are ‚Äúa lot of suitors‚Äù interested in AEW programming. When Khan was specifically asked by [Wrestlenomics‚Äô Brandon Thurston](https://twitter.com/BrandonThurston) to explain AEW‚Äôs drop in TV ratings year-over-year, he focused on ratings for WWE Raw and AEW Dynamite being down a similar amount in the fourth quarter (Q4) of 2023 compared to the same quarter in 2022: ‚ÄúYou say Raw is down 8% and Dynamite‚Äôs down 10%...that‚Äôs very similar, and both of those are ahead of the decline in cable television. Cable television is down a lot more than 10% year-over-year. And both of us, Raw is down 8% and Dynamite down 10%, are beating the hell out of gravity. And both of us are looking at a big pay raise this year, for Dynamite and Raw. And Raw having made 265 million dollars a year last year, for them to get a pay raise, that‚Äôs gonna be a really big number for them. And for us, it‚Äôs a lot of money too.‚Äù ...Both shows are probably due for a big rights fee increase, and frankly percentage-wise, especially Dynamite because of where we started and how we performed...I think that both shows have done really well to, frankly defy gravity, and stay ahead of the drop, which as I understand is closer to 20%.‚Äù That‚Äôs a pretty sly move by Tony, anwering a question about AEW‚Äôs ratings drop to explain why AEW deserves a significant pay increase on its next TV deal. And he did so by putting AEW Dynamite in the same boat as WWE Raw, which most people understand will see a big money increase on its next TV deal. Does Tony Khan‚Äôs argument make sense to you, or is there a lot more to the story than just looking at Q4 numbers year-over-year? Let us know what you think in the comments below, Cagesiders.

author: Douglas Helm
title: Blue Origin Rocket Explodes And Implodes For Jeff Bezos
text:
Jeff Bezos and his Blue Origin company have some catching up to do. The rocket company was contracted by NASA to build an orbital rocket, titled New Glenn, for the EscaPADE mission that is scheduled to launch in October. However, apparently, the team is facing some major setbacks in the development process, with an upper rocket portion failing and exploring during a recent stress test.
Under Pressure, Literally And Figuratively The Blue Origin team has a tight window to get the New Glenn orbital rocket ready to launch since the EscaPADE mission is sending two spacecraft to Mars and is hoping to take advantage of Earth and Mars alignment this year. The planets won‚Äôt be this close for another two years, so the October deadline is an ideal time for the mission to start. However, the upper rocket failing during the stress test isn‚Äôt the only problem, as another portion of the rocket imploded after engineers failed to put the necessary pressure-release valves in place before the New Glenn was moved from a humid outdoor hangar to an air-conditioned environment.
Compounding Issues Complicate Upcoming Mission Explosions and implosions are the last thing you want to see when launching a rocket, so Blue Origin will definitely need to get these kinks ironed out as soon as possible. But based on these setbacks, it seems highly unlikely that the rocket is going to be set for a full-on mission by October. Additionally, the New Glenn is apparently four years behind schedule, so clearly these issues have been compounding for a while.
Blue Origin‚Äôs Personnel Changes Amidst all of this testing chaos, Blue Origin has also made major moves internally, as a new CEO, David Limp, was appointed in December. Limp himself has made some big changes to the company‚Äôs executives and the company continues to rapidly make new hires. Despite all this, a spokesperson for Blue Origin did say that the team is working on assembling the rocket and that it‚Äôs still on track to launch New Glenn this year.
Rocket Lab Going Into Hero Mode Its possible missed launch for a NASA contract isn‚Äôt the only issue that Blue Origin has faced in recent years, as the company also had to shut down its New Shepard space tourism shuttle for over a year after an engine explosion occurred in September 2022. It remains to be seen if the space company can get through these obstacles and get it together in just a couple of months.
Rocket Lab, the company doing the building of the spacecraft, has said it‚Äôs going into ‚Äúhero mode‚Äù to make the launch happen for what it‚Äôs worth, but a tight timeline is still a tight timeline.
May Have To Wait For The Next Mars Mission Blue Origin designed the New Glenn as a spacecraft that would be capable of taking satellites and people into Earth‚Äôs orbit, making it a competitor of other major space companies like Elon Musk‚Äôs SpaceX. The EscaPADE mission is a big first test for this rocket, and its ultimate goal is to get two spacecraft to Mars to study the big red planet‚Äôs magnetic field. It‚Äôs possible that Blue Origin will make the cut, but it seems like it‚Äôs going to be down to the wire.
Source: Bloomberg

author: Redacci√≥n EFEverde
title: Fuertes tormentas y olas de calor dejan once muertos en Australia
text:
S√≠dney (Australia) (EFE).- Australia afronta el √∫ltimo fin de semana del a√±o y la celebraci√≥n de A√±o Nuevo entre avisos de fuertes tormentas en el este del pa√≠s, que ya han dejado once muertos, y olas de calor en el oeste y norte de la naci√≥n oce√°nica.
Temperaturas extremas en el oeste Seg√∫n el √∫ltimo pron√≥stico del Departamento de Climatolog√≠a, la ciudad de Marble Bar, en el estado de Australia Occidental, podr√≠a alcanzar los 49 grados Celsius este s√°bado.
Una ola de calor que tambi√©n se registrar√° en otras jurisdicciones del pa√≠s y que ha llevado a las autoridades a mantenerse en alerta ante la posibilidad de que se produzcan incendios forestales.
Este golpe de calor en pleno verano austral coincide con nuevas tormentas previstas para los orientales estados de Queensland y Nueva Gales del Sur, que proseguir√°n hasta el lunes.
Fuertes lluvias y vientos Conforme al organismo oficial, algunas de estas tormentas traer√°n lluvias torrenciales y vientos de m√°s de 90 kil√≥metros por hora.
Esta semana al menos once personas han perdido la vida en el nororiental estado de Queensland y en el suroriental Victoria a ra√≠z de riadas y ca√≠da de √°rboles debido al fuerte temporal que azota la regi√≥n este de Australia.
A mediados de mes, adem√°s, el norte del pa√≠s sinti√≥ el golpe del cicl√≥n Jasper, de categor√≠a 2, que dej√≥ grandes inundaciones en algunas zonas del Territorio Norte.
Este verano austral, que discurre entre diciembre y febrero, se encuentra bajo la influencia del fen√≥meno El Ni√±o, que generalmente provoca temperaturas superiores a la media y se asocia a condiciones extremas que pueden hacer brotar incendios forestales, la llegada de ciclones y sequ√≠a. EFEverde

author: Alok KN Mishra
title: AAP hails SC‚Äôs Kejriwal bail order as ‚Äòvictory of truth‚Äô | Latest News India - Hindustan Times
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Friday hailed the Supreme Court order granting interim bail to Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal, calling it the victory of truth even as he will remain in jail in the separate Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) case in the excise policy matter.AAP general secretary Sandeep Pathak called the order historic and said the Supreme Court has demolished the so-called liquor scam by granting the bail. ‚ÄúNow the BJP [Bharatiya Janata Party] should close the case and not waste the time of the people. The BJP puts Opposition leaders in jail when it fails to defeat them in the elections.‚Äù Delhi minister Atishi said the judgement makes it clear that the investigation into the ‚Äúfake excise‚Äù scam is just a conspiracy of the BJP. She maintained Kejriwal was arrested without evidence. ‚ÄúWhen the Rouse Avenue [trial] court gave bail to Arvind Kejriwal, it made it clear that the ED does not have any evidence against Kejriwal and that the ED is working with a bias against him. The Supreme Court has put its stamp on the Rouse Avenue court verdict.‚Äù Atishi said the BJP arrested Kejriwal through the CBI so that he can be kept in jail. ‚ÄúThe interim bail makes it clear that Kejriwal is standing with truth and will continue to do so.‚Äù AAP Rajya Sabha member Sanjay Singh hit out at Prime Minister Narendra Modi. ‚ÄúModi, for how long will you keep the truth imprisoned by filing false cases? The whole country is watching your dictatorship. Be it...the Supreme Court, everyone believes that Kejriwal has been falsely implicated by ED. The decision of the Supreme Court is the victory of truth. Down with dictatorship,‚Äù Sanjay Singh said in a post on X.ED arrested Kejriwal on March 21 in its money laundering case related to alleged irregularities in the implementation of the now-scrapped Delhi excise policy 2021-22. The Supreme Court granted interim bail to him on May 10 for campaigning in the Lok Sabha elections.The trial court granted Kejriwal bail on June 20 before the high court stayed it. The CBI arrested Kejriwal on June 26 at the Rouse Avenue Court complex.Delhi BJP chief Virendra Sachdeva said that the interim bail does not mean that Kejriwal has been absolved of corruption. ‚Äú. The matter is still under the consideration of the court,‚Äù said Sachdeva. BJP lawmaker Vijender Gupta said AAP is celebrating as if Kejriwal has been absolved. ‚ÄúEven in [murder cases], the accused get bail‚Ä¶.‚Äù

author: Bruno Moraes
title: "√â hora de tentar entender a situa√ß√£o," afirma padre de S√£o Carlos sobre a sa√∫de do papa
text:
A interna√ß√£o do papa Francisco e o agravamento de seu estado de sa√∫de preocupa povos em todo o mundo.
Nas √∫ltimas horas, a Santa S√© emitiu comunicado informando que o sumo pont√≠fice apresentava ‚Äúquadro cl√≠nico complexo‚Äù que exigiria hospitaliza√ß√£o adequada.
Em Roma, o clima √© de ‚Äútentar entender o que est√° acontecendo com o papa‚Äù, na opini√£o do padre Robson Caramano. O religioso da Diocese de S√£o Carlos, est√° na capital italiana estudando mestrado em Filosofia.
‚ÄúEsse an√∫ncio do Vaticano mudou todo o cen√°rio, porque as interna√ß√µes dele j√° eram um pouco comuns, ent√£o agora com agravamento do quadro, o tornando complexo, muda um pouco as coisas‚Äù, afirmou.
Testemunha do desenrolar da situa√ß√£o, padre Robson afirma que a sa√∫de do papa j√° era uma preocupa√ß√£o entre os cat√≥licos nos √∫ltimos meses.
‚ÄúDesde √†s celebra√ß√µes do final do ano passado j√° perceb√≠amos aqui o Papa um pouco cansado. Recentemente, a presid√™ncia da Confer√™ncia Nacional dos Bispos do Brasil esteve com ele e, tamb√©m, demonstrou preocupa√ß√£o com seu estado de sa√∫de, por√©m afirmou que era de se admirar a maneira que ele se transformava quando era para expressar sua opini√£o‚Äù, ponderou o padre.
Sa√∫de fr√°gil
O papa Francisco est√° internado na Cl√≠nica Gemelli e deve ficar por l√° ao menos durante toda a semana.
Em boletim m√©dico, o Vaticano informa que a situa√ß√£o se encontra estacion√°ria e continua delicada.
O papa est√° com infec√ß√£o polimicrobiana no trato respirat√≥rio. A condi√ß√£o m√©dica fez com que a equipe que faz o atendimento hospitalar mudasse o medicamento, em nova abordagem terap√™utica.
Fique ON!
Quer se manter bem informado no maior portal de not√≠cias do interior de S√£o Paulo? Fique on com os nossos grupos e redes sociais, acesse abaixo:
üì≤ Fa√ßa uma den√∫ncia ou sugira uma reportagem sobre S√£o Carlos e regi√£o por meio do WhatsApp do acidade on: (16) 99149-9787.

author: Canadian Press
title: High winds return to B.C.'s central coast as more heat records fall
text:
VANCOUVER ‚Äî British Columbia's central coast is facing the return of strong winds reaching 90 kilometres an hour just days after the last such warning in the region.
Environment Canada says coastal areas from around Bella Bella south to around Sayward on Vancouver Island including Port Hardy and Port McNeill may see power outages and fallen tree branches because of the high winds.
A previous wind advisory on Wednesday warned of gusts up to 120 kilometres an hour along exposed areas of B.C.'s southern and central coasts.
The winds earlier in the week knocked out power to more than 1,000 BC Hydro customers on Cortes Island.
The El Ni√±o climate phenomenon and a ridge of high pressure over B.C.'s Interior continue to bring record high temperatures to the province, as another set of century-old marks were surpassed Thursday.
Environment Canada says Prince George saw temperatures spike to 8.7 degrees, breaking a record set in 1919, while Quesnel reached 9.1 degrees, surpassing a mark set in 1901.
Vernon recorded 6.1 degrees, breaking a record from 1908.
The federal weather agency says other heat records were broken in Vancouver, White Rock and Port Alberni, while Whistler on Thursday matched its previous high of 5.6 degrees set in 1956.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 29, 2023.
The Canadian Press

author: Joshua Clipperton, The Canadian Press
title: Oilers force Game 7 of Stanley Cup final with 5-1 win over Panthers ‚Äì Brandon Sun
text: Advertisement Read this article for free: or Already have an account? Log in here ¬ª We need your support! Local journalism needs your support! As we navigate through unprecedented times, our journalists are working harder than ever to bring you the latest local updates to keep you safe and informed. Now, more than ever, we need your support. Starting at $14.99 plus taxes every four weeks you can access your Brandon Sun online and full access to all content as it appears on our website. [Subscribe Now](/subscribe) or call circulation directly at (204) 727-0527. Your pledge helps to ensure we provide the news that matters most to your community! Read unlimited articles for free today: or Already have an account? Log in here ¬ª EDMONTON ‚Äì Connor McDavid dragged his team back into the Stanley Cup fight. Edmonton‚Äôs supporting cast grabbed the reins from their superstar captain Friday. Now the Oilers are one win from history. And the Panthers sit one loss from infamy. Zach Hyman scored his playoff-leading 16th goal and Stuart Skinner made 20 saves as Edmonton defeated Florida 5-1 on Friday to force Game 7. ‚ÄúThe league‚Äôs too good,‚Äù Oilers centre Leon Draisaitl said. ‚ÄúYou need depth, you need other guys to step up. We‚Äôve had that throughout the run.‚Äù Warren Foegele, with a goal and an assist, and Adam Henrique provided the rest of the offence before Ryan McLeod and Darnell Nurse added empty netters for Edmonton, which has stormed back with three consecutive victories to tie the title series after going down 3-0. Used to seeing his name in bright lights, Draisaitl had just two assists in the series entering Game 6 before setting up Foegele‚Äôs opener as one of 11 players ‚Äî none of them named McDavid ‚Äî to find the scoresheet. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a hell of a story so far,‚Äù said the German, who was critical of himself Friday morning. ‚ÄúReally proud to give ourselves a chance.‚Äù Aleksander Barkov replied for the Panthers ‚Äî a group that will head home searching for answers with their stranglehold on hockey‚Äôs holy grail having evaporated. Sergei Bobrovsky stopped 16 shots. ‚ÄúWe have good moments in the games,‚Äù said Barkov, whose team will host the winner-take-all finale Monday in Sunrise, Fla. ‚ÄúWe gotta take those to the next game.‚Äù Edmonton is looking to become only the fifth team in NHL history to win a best-of-seven showdown after trailing 3-0 ‚Äî and just the second in the Cup final, joining the 1942 Toronto Maple Leafs. ‚ÄúThe job is not done,‚Äù Hyman said. ‚ÄúEverybody will forget if we don‚Äôt finish it.‚Äù A win by the Oilers in the final game of the 2023-24 season would also mark the end to Canada‚Äôs 30-year Cup drought dating back to the 1993 Montreal Canadiens‚Äô victory over Wayne Gretzky‚Äôs Los Angeles Kings. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been a pretty loose group,‚Äù Edmonton head coach Kris Knoblauch said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nice to be around this team ‚Ä¶ they‚Äôre having the time of their lives.‚Äù The orange-and-blue party around Rogers Place started in the hours before the 6 p.m. local time puck drop. Well-lubricated fans lined up for blocks around the arena for a spot in the outdoor viewing area. Others crowded bars and patios in the sunshine with their hockey team still playing on the second day of summer. One group drove an Oilers-themed Zamboni around the streets in the city‚Äôs downtown core. The raucous atmosphere inside the rink hit a fever pitch when the Oilers hit the ice, with the scoreboard sound meter touching 113.8 decibels ahead of the latest NHL game ever played in Canada during a non-pandemic season. ‚ÄúIt means the world to us,‚Äù Draisaitl said of giving the home crowd a resounding sendoff. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been here for a long time and been through some pretty bad years. The people that were there tonight, they showed up every night. ‚ÄúTo give them that is really special.‚Äù Edmonton ‚Äî now 5-0 when facing elimination in these playoffs, including an 8-1 victory in Game 3 and a 5-3 triumph in Game 5 to stay alive thanks to consecutive four-point McDavid performances ‚Äî opened the scoring at 7:27 of the first period when Draisaitl found Foegele for his third of the post-season. The Oilers went up 2-0 just 46 seconds into the second off a 2-on-1 that saw Mattias Janmark find Henrique before he settled the puck and ripped his fourth. Barkov fired past Skinner just 10 seconds later, but Knoblauch correctly challenged for offside. ‚ÄúThe only hesitation was maybe there wasn‚Äôt the right video,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIn my mind it was definitely offside, but I guess you never know.‚Äù The Oilers killed off a penalty later in the period ‚Äî the 45th in the last 46 short-handed situations ‚Äî before Skinner made a good stop off Barkov on a 2-on-1. Hyman put his team up by three with 1:40 left in the second when he took a pass from Ryan Nugent-Hopkins and raced in on a breakaway and beat Bobrovsky to the backhand with his 70th overall including the regular season. The only other players with as many goals in a single post-season over the last 30 years are Joe Sakic (18 in 1996) and Pavel Bure (16 in 1994). Chants of ‚ÄúSer-gei! Ser-gei!‚Äù rang around the cavernous building as the clock ticked down with the Oilers holding an 18-4 aggregate score over the Panthers since the third period of Game 3. Florida got on the board at 1:28 of the third when Edmonton couldn‚Äôt get the puck out and Barkov wove in front to slide his eighth past Skinner. Edmonton forward Derek Ryan then took a high-sticking penalty, but his teammates once again killed off the threat before McLeod and Nurse, with a primary assist from Skinner after a terrific save, scored into the empty net to spark wild scenes inside and outside Rogers Place. A team that climbed out of a regular-season hole that had them sitting 32nd in the overall standings before eventually going on a 16-game winning streak ‚Äî and a pair of other long runs ‚Äî the Oilers now head to South Florida sitting one win from hockey‚Äôs ultimate prize. ‚ÄúGame 7‚Äôs going to be my last game coaching this group,‚Äù Knoblauch said. ‚ÄúSome people are going to be moving on, that‚Äôs just the nature of the business. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a real pleasure.‚Äù There‚Äôs just 60 minutes ‚Äî and perhaps more ‚Äî to go. This report by The Canadian Press was first published June 21, 2024. ___ Follow @JClipperton_CP on X.

author: Eric Ramirez
title: La CDMX sigue rompiendo r√©cords de calor: m√°s de 34 grados cent√≠grados y ni siquiera ha empezado el verano
text: La tarde de este jueves 9 de mayo del 2024 la Ciudad de M√©xico report√≥ una nueva temperatura m√°xima hist√≥rica, de acuerdo con el [Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional](https://twitter.com/conagua_clima/status/1788714661346705609/photo/1) (SMN), llegando hasta los 34.3 grados cent√≠grados. Recordemos que hace menos de un mes se hab√≠a sobrepasado [otro m√°ximo hist√≥rico de calor](https://www.xataka.com.mx/ecologia-y-naturaleza/cdmx-rompe-record-temperatura-nunca-se-habia-registrado-calor-como-este-15-abril), cuando la capital del pa√≠s lleg√≥ hasta los 34.2 grados cent√≠grados. La noticia llega justo despu√©s de que la CDMX activ√≥ la [contingencia ambiental en toda la capital y Megal√≥polis](https://www.xataka.com.mx/automovil/se-activa-contingencia-ambiental-ciudad-mexico-edomex-estos-autos-no-circulan-viernes-10-mayo), debido a que se alcanzaron concentraciones m√°ximas de ozono de 158 ppb en la estaci√≥n de monitoreo de la delegaci√≥n Gustavo A. Madero. Adem√°s, este mismo d√≠a en varias partes del pa√≠s se alcanzaron 45¬∞C, como parte de la [segunda ola de calor](https://www.xataka.com.mx/ecologia-y-naturaleza/empieza-fase-brutal-ola-calor-mexico-45-grados-estos-estados) y reportes indican que esta tendencia continuar√° por lo menos durante dos d√≠as m√°s. Pero no todas son malas noticias, el SMN [estima](https://smn.conagua.gob.mx/es/pronosticos/pronosticossubmenu/pronostico-extendido-a-96-horas) que el 11 de mayo finalizar√° la ola de calor debido a un frente fr√≠o. Qu√© precauciones tomar ante estas temperaturas Para hacerle frente a las [olas de calor en la Ciudad de M√©xico y el resto del pa√≠s](https://www.xataka.com.mx/ecologia-y-naturaleza/empieza-fase-brutal-ola-calor-mexico-45-grados-estos-estados), en donde continuar√°n las temperaturas m√°ximas entre 40 y 45 ¬∞C, se recomienda: - Usar bloqueador solar - Usar gafas y sombrero - No pasar demasiado tiempo en exteriores, de ser posible. Especialmente en horarios de 14:00 a 18:00 horas. - Beber abundantes l√≠quidos - Evitar comer en la v√≠a p√∫blica porque los alimentos se descomponen r√°pidamente - Poner especial atenci√≥n a las personas alrededor, especialmente a beb√©s, ni√±os y adultos mayores.
